parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.70

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Interaction

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> When MFD is using user controllers, this command can set values on them. For example, MFD config for Blackfoot has an entry
<ext><name>syntaxhighlight</name><attr> lang=cpp</attr><inner>
...
class Draw
{
	alpha = "user3";
	color[] = {"user0","user1","user2"};
...
</inner><close></syntaxhighlight></close></ext>
which could control color of the MFD. See Example 2-3-4 on how to set different colors of the Blackfoot MFD

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> vehicle '''setUserMFDValue''' [index, value]

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicle: [[Object]] - an vehicle with MFD

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> index: [[Number]] - index of custom MFD user actions

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> value: [[Number]] - value which should custom source return in MFD

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code> BIS_Plane [[setUserMFDValue]] [0,1]; // user0 in MFD will return 1</code>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> Set MFD Red:<code>Blackfoot [[setUserMFDValue]] [0, 1]; // "user0" - 1
Blackfoot [[setUserMFDValue]] [1, 0]; // "user1" - 0
Blackfoot [[setUserMFDValue]] [2, 0]; // "user2" - 0
Blackfoot [[setUserMFDValue]] [3, 1]; // "user3" - 1</code>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> Set MFD pale Blue:<code>Blackfoot [[setUserMFDValue]] [0, 0]; // "user0" - 0
Blackfoot [[setUserMFDValue]] [1, 0]; // "user1" - 0
Blackfoot [[setUserMFDValue]] [2, 1]; // "user2" - 1
Blackfoot [[setUserMFDValue]] [3, 0.1]; // "user3" - 0.1</code>

</value></part><part><name>x4</name>=<value> Hide MFD:<code>Blackfoot [[setUserMFDValue]] [3, 0]; // "user3" - 0</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[getUserMFDValue]], [[setUserMFDText]], [[getUserMFDText]]
</value></part></template>


<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template></root>
